column3: Gyoei of Yuzuka Manor is looking for an adventurer with the constitution to see his deed done.
Speak with the magatsu koja and defeat any enemies that appear.
Deliver the muddy purse to Gyoei.
You're the strongest-looking adventurer I've seen all day! Very sturdy, very solid. I've a deed I'd like to ask of you.

Allow me to explain. Some days past, I was walking near the large gate just behind our manor, here. Well, you can imagine my surprise when I came under attack by a massive koja, big and round as a goobbue's belly! I escaped without injury, but the cursed thing made off with my coinpurse.

Those contestable koja are always making life hard for us Namazu. Could you go and have words with them? I know of no other way to retrieve my coinpurse. And if they won't return it, you have my leave to be as rough as you like!
Could you go and have words with those contestable koja? I know of no other way to retrieve my coinpurse. And if they won't return it, you have my leave to be as rough as you like!
The magatsu koja casts his gaze toward the One River. Perhaps what you seek lies in that direction.
Did you punish those koja for what they did? Chastise them, beat them?
Well, thank you for that. And you got my coinpurse back! I had nearly given up hope.
I pray your words serve to calm them for a spell. We Namazu cannot suffer much more harassment at their...heads.

This gil did not come easy. It was born of my labor. Of my sweat and tears. I worked hard, picking flowers. Soaking them and flavoring them. I sell and serve them to the people here, and all who buy them sing their praises. I am grateful for what you did this day.
